story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Filthy 50 land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Filthy 50? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Filthy 50 scored 54 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Filthy 50. Northern Minnesota (route varies). 50 mi. 50 miles, 3 thousand ft. 80% gravel, 20% dirt. Rolling Minnesota terrain. Fall foliage. Technical rating: 2/5.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Community. 4 out of 5. The post-race scene is half the event. Value. 4 out of 5. Good value. More bang for your buck than most. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Competent operation. Shows up on time. Downtown Lanesboro start at 10 a. Climate. 3 out of 5. Variable. Bring layers and a flexible attitude. Historical weather data shows average highs of 54°F and lows of 41°F, with a 41% chance of rain on any given day. Adventure. 3 out of 5. This race takes you somewhere different. The route winds through golden valleys and wooded ridges with landmarks like mid-course churches and bridges marking the journey. Race Quality. 3 out of 5. Well-run race. Professional touches throughout. The course delivers proper gravel challenge through varied terrain with meaningful elevation and technical features like Raptor Ridge. Experience. 3 out of 5. The experience justifies the entry fee. The complete package spans pre-race breakfast at Tarsilla's to post-ride celebrations with Sylvan Brewing and food trucks in downtown Lanesboro. Field Depth. 3 out of 5. Solid field depth. Competitive across the board.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest. Quick-fire. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Plan for a few hundred all-in. Length. 2 out of 5. Manageable distance. Back by lunch. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Elevation. 2 out of 5. A few hills. Nothing to lose sleep over. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Minnesota Fall Gravel. If you're looking for a chill fall colors tour with 3 thousand feet of rolling climbs, this works. The Lanesboro setting is pretty, the vibe is friendly, and 50 miles won't destroy your weekend. Skip it if you want real competition or technical challenge. this is more community ride than gravel race. Any decent gravel bike handles these roads fine.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Filthy 50 isn't quite right for you. Almanzo 100 gives you proper Minnesota suffering if you want the real thing. While Gravel Worlds in Nebraska delivers actual competition with similar Midwest charm but higher stakes.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Filthy 50? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'Filthy 50' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
